1:
A fool says in his heart, "There is no God."
\q They are corrupt and have done abominable iniquity;
\q there is no one who does good.
\q
2:
God looks down from heaven on the children of mankind
\q to see if there are any who understand,
\q who seek after him.
\q
3:
They have all turned away. Together they have become corrupt.
\q There is not one who does good, not even one.
4:
Do those who commit iniquity have no understandingâ€”
\q those who devour my people as if they were eating bread
\q and they do not call on God?
\q
6:
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come from Zion!
\q When God brings back his people from the captivity,
\q then Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad!
53:
\m
\d For the chief musician; set to Mahalath. A maschil of David.
\q
